alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 20 at 8:29PM MST until March 21 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST /3 PM MDT/ TUESDAY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 7000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches above 8000 feet with 1 to 5 inches down to 7000 feet. The heaviest snow is expected Tuesday morning through early afternoon. Winds gusting as high as 35 to 40 mph this afternoon and again Tuesday afternoon. * WHERE...Areas above 7000 feet near Buffalo Pass as well as Navajo National Monument, Wheatfields, Tsaile, and Sawmill. * WHEN...Until 2 PM MST /3 PM MDT/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Additional snow forecast from 8 PM Today to 2 PM Tuesday: Buffalo Pass 6 to 12 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau
